name: HYATT house Denver Tech Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband a I went for a one night getaway for our anniversary. We mentioned to the front desk it was our anniversary, and about an hour later, they came knocking on our door with a bottle of champagne and microwave popcorn!! What a great surprise!!! Our room was clean and and felt like a small apartment. It was so nice to have the kitchen appliances. We walked over to the Traildust for dinner and brought our leftovers back to the room. There is also 3 Margaritas within walking distance. The breakfast in the morning was perfect, lots of variety. We are planning to stay again this month.
reviews.title: WOW - What Service!!

reviews.text: Who: 45 female
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Location is not convenient to Denver

reviews.title: Terrific when it could have been terrible!

likes.liked: — Great staff, plenty of room, free shuttle anywhere within 5 miles!

reviews.text: Why: Attending Democratic Convention
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great area.

reviews.text: Location: Not really near anything but we had a rental car to get around in (about 30+ miles from Denver Intn'l Airport and from downtown Center)
reviews.title: Nice spacious room, lots of free food!

likes.liked: — The spacious room and the free breakfast and evening appetizers
likes.disliked: — We booked using Hyatt rewards points, which was an ENORMOUS hassle.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my parents. We absolutely loved this place.. Spacious, so near to Denver main streets but very quite. The breakfast was very good and healthy choices.. the hotels restaurant was open till 11pm and had excellent choices for vegans too!! just loved staying here..
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: We stayed 1 night during Memorial Day weekend 2009 (4 adults - 2 rooms) and had a very enjoyable experience...
reviews.title: Great Hotel; Great Price

reviews.text: We got an excellent AAA rate of $59...the suites were simply beautiful. Looking at some of the older reviews posted here, it looks like the kitchens have got a major upgrade...they all sport new stainless steel appliances. There are 2 flat panel TVs - one in the living area and one in the bedroom.....free wi-fi, good breakfast.......the works!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: The only aspect that wasn't "wow" were the bathrooms. They were a little old and not brand spanking new......nevertheless fully functional and absolutely no complaints....
reviews.title: What a deal!
Incredible Place to Stay!
reviews.text: Reserved at last minute in order to get a 2 bedroom suite. Outstanding experience and value overall. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout. Good location - convenient to highway without the noise, and plenty of local/independent food options within an easy drive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great breakfast buffet with waffles, eggs etc. Very nice hotel in DTC right off highway. Room was VERY nice, roomy, 2 room suite, even though I reserved a one room suite. All new furniture, flat panel LCDs in each room. Great kitchen. Great workout room.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.text: It's really hard to find anything wrong with this hotel. I've stayed here 2 times now on business and have been very impressed both times. It's an all-suite hotel of course that has been remodeled apparently recently with very modern, chic furnishings and every comfort of home.
reviews.title: A Suite Deal

reviews.text: Both times I have stayed here I was greeted within minutes of my getting to the room by a staff member who had a welcome letter from the manager along with some fruit, candy and water for my use. A very nice touch (and I'm not even a Hyatt frequent guest member). The check-in was very speedy and friendly. And, on my last stay I was extremely impressed by Chris at the front desk who literally was doing about 5 things at once and doing them all well. He also noted as I checked in that my room was not yet ready (even though it was after 5pm) but without skipping a beat he had called housekeeping, confirmed a new room and had me on my way. And, as it turned out it was a 2-bedroom suite even though I had reserved the 1-bedroom! A really sweet deal although I couldn't make up my mind which bedroom to sleep in each night.
reviews.title: Luxe Home Away From Home

reviews.text: The bedrooms are completely closed off by french doors to the living area for privacy. Both the bedroom and LR have flat panel TVs. Everything was clean and the size of the rooms was very accommodating. The business center downstairs has free use of the internet and parking around the facility is easy, plentiful and free as well. The hotel sits just next to Interstate 25 so you have access to quickly get anywhere in Denver but the hotel is very quiet. I never heard anything outside my room. It's also not far (about a mile) from a train station to the rapid transit system that can get you to downtown and other venues.
reviews.title: Watch your belongings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a manager reception at night which provides a nice snack to get you started (or if you eat enough of it you might just skip dinner). Overall this is a great value especially for extended stays.
reviews.title: Awesome, as always

reviews.text: I have not yet stayed at this hotel, but I know that they are price gouging guests in Aug. I know that the DNC is coming to town, but charging $700 a night is, one against the law, because on the back of hotel doors it states that they are only allowed to charge a given amount of money. For a limited service hotel, that amount of money is rediculous. I would never stay at this hotel because of it. They are theifs and people need to stay away.
reviews.title: Price gouging!!

reviews.text: Won this hotel through a blind bid for $36! Very last minute, booked that afternoon and I stayed less than 12 hours. Check in was quick and the attendant wrote my room number and never said it aloud, as it should always be done.
reviews.title: Perfect for South Tech Center

likes.liked: — Great price for a suite and breakfast included. Location.

reviews.text: I was given a two bedroom suite, full kitchen, and living room with plasma TV. The decor was stylish, silver and dark wood, couch and pillow modern design. Except for the flowered bedspreads which did not match at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel for Great Price!

likes.liked: — modern and comfortable, great amenities and extras

reviews.text: Shower was fine, but nothing special. One of those cheap fitted tub remodel deals.
reviews.title: Awesome!

likes.liked: — Everything! Rooms were comfortable, clean, up to date.

reviews.text: Only sounds I heard were from the hallway, not from other rooms.
reviews.title: Do not stay here

likes.liked: — Near many shops and decent restaurants
likes.disliked: — Inadequate staff, no night manager or maintenance, half the outlets didn't work

aka: Hyatt Summerfield Suites Denver Tech Hotel
